page.title: 02Cropredy Village
page.content: Cropredy is a quiet,quaint place.It is quite a big village,there is a school, five shops, a Post Office,a builders merchants and a garden centre. The Wavy Line is a supermarket, it is owned by Mr & Mrs Bray.It sells sweets and food and general goods. The Wavy Line is by the Green. The Green has a tree on it.There is a small P.O.it is run by Mr & Mrs Rolph and is in the front room of their house. They also do the milk round.There is a second-hand clothes shop, the owner is Mrs Manley, she lives in Great Bourton, the village at the top of the hill.The Wharf is a craft shop, it has tea rooms attached. It is along-side the canal.Opposite there is a coal merchants.On the bridge over the canal is the Bridge Stores owned by Mr Clarke. Cherry & Sons are an old building firm ,they also own the builders merchants/garden centre.
